text: Zion Glorified
“Arise, shine! For your light has come,
and the glory of Yahweh has risen on you.
For look! darkness shall cover \add the\add* earth,
and thick darkness \add the\add* peoples,
but\f + \fr 60:2 \ft Or “and” \f* Yahweh will rise on you,
and his glory will appear over you.
And nations shall come to your light,
and kings to the bright light of your sunrise.
Lift up your eyes all around and see!
All of them gather; they come to you.
Your sons shall come from afar,
and your daughters shall be looked after on \add the\add* hip.
Then you shall see
and you shall be radiant;
and your heart shall tremble
and open itself wide,
because \add the\add* abundance of \add the\add* sea shall fall upon you;
\add the\add* wealth of \add the\add* nations shall come to you.
A multitude of camels shall cover you,
the young male camels of Midian and Ephah.
All those from Sheba shall come;
they shall bring gold and frankincense,
and they shall proclaim the praise of Yahweh.
All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered to you;
the rams of Nebaioth shall serve you.
They shall present a sacrifice for favor \add on\add* my altar,
and I will glorify ⸤my honorable house⸥.\f + \fr 60:7 \ft Literally “house of my honor” \f*
Who \add are\add* these? They fly like \add a\add* cloud,
and like doves to their coops.
Because \add the\add* coastlands wait for me,
and the ships of Tarshish \add are\add* first
to bring your children from afar,
their silver and gold with them,
for the name of Yahweh your God,
and for the holy one of Israel, because he has glorified you.
And ⸤foreigners⸥\f + \fr 60:10 \ft Literally “sons of a foreign country” \f* shall build your walls,
and their kings shall serve you,
for in my anger I struck you,
but\f + \fr 60:10 \ft Or “and” \f* in my favor I have taken pity on you.
And your gates shall continually be open,
day and night they shall not be shut,
to bring you \add the\add* wealth of nations,
and their kings shall be led.
For the nation and the kingdom that will not serve you shall perish,
and the nations shall be utterly devastated.
The glory of Lebanon shall come to you;
\add the\add* cypress, \add the\add* plane, and \add the\add* pine together,
to glorify the place of my sanctuary,
and I will do honor to the place of my feet.
And the children of those who oppressed you shall come to you bending low,
and all those who treated you disrespectfully shall bow down at the soles of your feet.
And they shall call you the city of Yahweh,
Zion \add of\add* the holy one of Israel.
Instead of you being forsaken
and hated ⸤with no one passing through,⸥\f + \fr 60:15 \ft Or “and there is not one who passes through” \f*
I will ⸤make⸥\f + \fr 60:15 \ft Literally “place” \f* you an everlasting ⸤object of pride⸥,\f + \fr 60:15 \ft Literally “pride” \f*
a joy of ⸤coming generations⸥.\f + \fr 60:15 \ft Literally “generation and generation” \f*
And you shall suck \add the\add* milk of nations,
and suck \add the\add* breast of kings,
and you shall know that I \add am\add* Yahweh your Savior,
and your Redeemer, the Strong One of Jacob.
Instead of bronze I will bring gold,
and instead of iron I will bring silver,
and instead of wood, bronze,
and instead of stones, iron.
And I will ⸤appoint⸥\f + \fr 60:17 \ft Literally “put” \f* peace \add as\add* your overseer,
and righteousness \add as\add* ⸤your ruling body⸥.\f + \fr 60:17 \ft Literally “they who force you to work” \f*
Violence shall no longer be heard in your land;
devastation or\f + \fr 60:18 \ft Or “and” \f* destruction on your borders.
And you shall call your walls Salvation,
and your gates, Praise.
The sun shall no longer be your light by day,
and for bright light the moon shall not give you light,
but\f + \fr 60:19 \ft Or “and” \f* Yahweh will be your everlasting light,
and your God your glory.
Your sun shall no longer go \add down\add*,
and your moon shall not ⸤wane⸥,\f + \fr 60:20 \ft Literally “be taken away” \f*
for Yahweh himself will be your everlasting light,
and your days of mourning shall come to an end.
And all your people \add shall be\add* righteous;
they shall take possession of \add the\add* land forever,
the shoot of his\f + \fr 60:21 \ft The reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) has “my” \f* planting,
the work of my hands, to show my glory.
The small \add one\add* shall become \add a\add* tribe,
and the smallest one a mighty nation.
I \add am\add* Yahweh; I will hasten it in its time.”
